values.authorQuote: I didn't want to look like anyone else - like Janis Joplin or Grace Slick. That's why I never went to any of the big designers.
values.author: Stevie Nicks

values.authorQuote: Even in my really bad, drugged-out days, I didn't go away. I still toured, still did interviews. I never gave up the fight. That's why I'm who I am today, because I didn't leave. And I think I made the right choice.
values.author: Stevie Nicks

values.authorQuote: Everything on this record is what I really wanted to say, and I'm back to being the poet I always thought I was.
values.author: Stevie Nicks

values.authorQuote: For 70 nights, right across America, I've been getting out there with two ex-lovers and we've been playing songs which are so specific about each of us, you just wouldn't know. We're friends now but we can't forget what happened between us.
values.author: Stevie Nicks

values.authorQuote: He and I were about as compatible as a rat and a boa constrictor.
values.author: Stevie Nicks

values.authorQuote: I hated Chris, my brother. I would pull his hair and kick him, until one day my father gave him permission to fight back. I'll be apologizing to him for the rest of my life.
values.author: Stevie Nicks

values.authorQuote: I made a conscious decision that I was not going to have children. I didn't want others raising them, and looking after them myself would get in the way of being a musician and writer.
values.author: Stevie Nicks

values.authorQuote: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: Know thy self, know thy enemy. A thousand battles, a thousand victories.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: If you know the enemy and know yourself you need not fear the results of a hundred battles.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: Know your enemy and know yourself and you can fight a hundred battles without disaster.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: Pretend inferiority and encourage his arrogance.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: He will win who knows when to fight and when not to fight.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: Be extremely subtle, even to the point of formlessness. Be extremely mysterious, even to the point of soundlessness. Thereby you can be the director of the opponent's fate.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: Regard your soldiers as your children, and they will follow you into the deepest valleys; look on them as your own beloved sons, and they will stand by you even unto death.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: The art of war teaches us to rely not on the likelihood of the enemy's not coming, but on our own readiness to receive him; not on the chance of his not attacking, but rather on the fact that we have made our position unassailable.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: A good commander is benevolent and unconcerned with fame.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: All men can see these tactics whereby I conquer, but what none can see is the strategy out of which victory is evolved.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: The art of war is of vital importance to the state. It is a matter of life and death, a road either to safety or to ruin. Hence it is a subject of inquiry which can on no account be neglected.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: If you are far from the enemy, make him believe you are near.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: Confront them with annihilation, and they will then survive; plunge them into a deadly situation, and they will then live. When people fall into danger, they are then able to strive for victory.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: Invincibility lies in the defence; the possibility of victory in the attack.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: Victory usually goes to the army who has better trained officers and men.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: Quickness is the essence of the war.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: To fight and conquer in all our battles is not supreme excellence; supreme excellence consists in breaking the enemy's resistance without fighting.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: He will win whose army is animated by the same spirit throughout all its ranks.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: The general who wins the battle makes many calculations in his temple before the battle is fought. The general who loses makes but few calculations beforehand.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: If your opponent is of choleric temper, irritate him.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: He who knows when he can fight and when he cannot, will be victorious.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: Hence that general is skilful in attack whose opponent does not know what to defend; and he is skilful in defense whose opponent does not know what to attack.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: The quality of decision is like the well-timed swoop of a falcon which enables it to strike and destroy its victim.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: The good fighters of old first put themselves beyond the possibility of defeat, and then waited for an opportunity of defeating the enemy.
values.author: Sun Tzu

values.authorQuote: Men, their rights, and nothing more; women, their rights, and nothing less.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: I declare to you that woman must not depend upon the protection of man, but must be taught to protect herself, and there I take my stand.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: The day may be approaching when the whole world will recognize woman as the equal of man.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: It was we, the people; not we, the white male citizens; nor yet we, the male citizens; but we, the whole people, who formed the Union. And we formed it, not to give the blessings of liberty, but to secure them; not to the half of ourselves and the half of our posterity, but to the whole people - women as well as men.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: There never will be complete equality until women themselves help to make laws and elect lawmakers.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: An oligarchy of race, where the Saxon rules the African, might be endured; but this oligarchy of sex which makes father, brothers, husband, sons, the oligarchs over the mother and sisters, the wife and daughters of every household... carries discord and rebellion into every home of the nation.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: I do not demand equal pay for any women save those who do equal work in value. Scorn to be coddled by your employers; make them understand that you are in their service as workers, not as women.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: Independence is happiness.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: She who succeeds in gaining the mastery of the bicycle will gain the mastery of life.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: The older I get, the greater power I seem to have to help the world; I am like a snowball - the further I am rolled the more I gain.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: No man is good enough to govern any woman without her consent.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: I think the girl who is able to earn her own living and pay her own way should be as happy as anybody on earth. The sense of independence and security is very sweet.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: I have given my life and all I am to it, and now I want my last act to be to give it all I have, to the last cent.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: I will cut off this right arm of mine before I will ask for the ballot for the Negro and not for the woman.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: Oh, if I could but live another century and see the fruition of all the work for women! There is so much yet to be done.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: Join the union, girls, and together say Equal Pay for Equal Work.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: Organize, agitate, educate, must be our war cry.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: There is not a woman born who desires to eat the bread of dependence.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: Being persons, then, women are citizens; and no state has a right to make any new law, or to enforce any old law, that shall abridge their privileges or immunities.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: No self-respecting woman should wish or work for the success of a party who ignores her sex.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: Failure is impossible.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: Trust me that as I ignore all law to help the slave, so will I ignore it all to protect an enslaved woman.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: The only question left to be settled now is: Are women persons? And I hardly believe any of our opponents will have the hardihood to say they are not.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: Woman must have a purse of her own, and how can this be so long as the law denies to the wife all right to both the individual and the joint earnings?
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: No one can doubt that the sufferings of the sober, virtuous woman, in legal subjection to the mastership of a drunken, immoral husband and father over herself and children, not only from physical abuse, but from spiritual shame and humiliation, must be such as the man himself can not possibly comprehend.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: For every betrayed woman, there is always the betrayer, man.
values.author: Susan B. Anthony

values.authorQuote: You cannot believe in God until you believe in yourself.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life - think of it, dream of it, live on that idea. Let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body, be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: Arise! Awake! and stop not until the goal is reached.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: The world is the great gymnasium where we come to make ourselves strong.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: Where can we go to find God if we cannot see Him in our own hearts and in every living being.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: You have to grow from the inside out. None can teach you, none can make you spiritual. There is no other teacher but your own soul.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: We are what our thoughts have made us; so take care about what you think. Words are secondary. Thoughts live; they travel far.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: Truth can be stated in a thousand different ways, yet each one can be true.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: Our duty is to encourage every one in his struggle to live up to his own highest idea, and strive at the same time to make the ideal as near as possible to the Truth.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: That man has reached immortality who is disturbed by nothing material.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: In one word, this ideal is that you are divine.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: God is to be worshipped as the one beloved, dearer than everything in this and next life.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: External nature is only internal nature writ large.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: The moment I have realized God sitting in the temple of every human body, the moment I stand in reverence before every human being and see God in him - that moment I am free from bondage, everything that binds vanishes, and I am free.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: The whole secret of existence is to have no fear. Never fear what will become of you, depend on no one. Only the moment you reject all help are you freed.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: All differences in this world are of degree, and not of kind, because oneness is the secret of everything.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: All the powers in the universe are already ours. It is we who have put our hands before our eyes and cry that it is dark.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: The more we come out and do good to others, the more our hearts will be purified, and God will be in them.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: When an idea exclusively occupies the mind, it is transformed into an actual physical or mental state.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: If money help a man to do good to others, it is of some value; but if not, it is simply a mass of evil, and the sooner it is got rid of, the better.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: Condemn none: if you can stretch out a helping hand, do so. If you cannot, fold your hands, bless your brothers, and let them go their own way.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: May He who is the Brahman of the Hindus, the Ahura-Mazda of the Zoroastrians, the Buddha of the Buddhists, the Jehovah of the Jews, the Father in Heaven of the Christians give strength to you to carry out your noble idea.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: The will is not free - it is a phenomenon bound by cause and effect - but there is something behind the will which is free.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: The Vedanta recognizes no sin it only recognizes error. And the greatest error, says the Vedanta is to say that you are weak, that you are a sinner, a miserable creature, and that you have no power and you cannot do this and that.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: Never think there is anything impossible for the soul. It is the greatest heresy to think so. If there is sin, this is the only sin; to say that you are weak, or others are weak.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: As different streams having different sources all mingle their waters in the sea, so different tendencies, various though they appear, crooked or straight, all lead to God.
values.author: Swami Vivekananda
values.authorOccupation: Indian Hindu monk, chief disciple of Indian
values.authorBirthplace: Calcutta, Bengal Presidency, British India mystic Ramakrishna

values.authorQuote: Kiss me and you will see how important I am.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: It is as if my life were magically run by two electric currents: joyous positive and despairing negative - whichever is running at the moment dominates my life, floods it.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: Perhaps when we find ourselves wanting everything, it is because we are dangerously close to wanting nothing.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: There must be quite a few things a hot bath won't cure, but I don't know many of them.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: And by the way, everything in life is writable about if you have the outgoing guts to do it, and the imagination to improvise. The worst enemy to creativity is self-doubt.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: How frail the human heart must be - a mirrored pool of thought.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: If you expect nothing from anybody, you're never disappointed.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: But life is long. And it is the long run that balances the short flare of interest and passion.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: I took a deep breath and listened to the old bray of my heart. I am. I am. I am.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: Today is the first of August. It is hot, steamy and wet. It is raining. I am tempted to write a poem. But I remember what it said on one rejection slip: 'After a heavy rainfall, poems titled 'Rain' pour in from across the nation.'
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: Indecision and reveries are the anesthetics of constructive action.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: How we need another soul to cling to.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: I am too pure for you or anyone.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: When you are insane, you are busy being insane - all the time.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: Dying is an art, like everything else. I do it exceptionally well. I do it so it feels like hell. I do it so it feels real. I guess you could say I've a call.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: I have the choice of being constantly active and happy or introspectively passive and sad.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: I want to live and feel all the shades, tones, and variations of mental and physical experience possible in my life. And I am horribly limited.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: If I have not the power to put myself in the place of other people, but must be continually burrowing inward, I shall never be the magnanimous creative person I wish to be. Yet I am hypnotized by the workings of the individual, alone, and am continually using myself as a specimen.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: There must be quite a few things that a hot bath won't cure, but I don't know many of them.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: What I want back is what I was.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: Mother believed that I should have an enormous amount of sleep, and so I was never really tired when I went to bed. This was the best time of day, when I could lie in the vague twilight, drifting off to sleep, making up dreams inside my head the way they should go.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: Poetry, I feel, is a tyrannical discipline. You've got to go so far so fast in such a small space; you've got to burn away all the peripherals.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: There is an increasing market for mental hospital stuff. I am a fool if I don't relive it, recreate it.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: Apparently, the most difficult feat for a Cambridge male is to accept a woman not merely as feeling, not merely as thinking, but as managing a complex, vital interweaving of both.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: Every woman adores a Fascist.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: I am a victim of introspection.
values.author: Sylvia Plath

values.authorQuote: We think that forgiveness is weakness, but it's absolutely not; it takes a very strong person to forgive.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: I want to congratulate all the men out there who are working diligently to be good fathers whether they are stepfathers, or biological fathers or just spiritual fathers.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: I like to see myself as a bridge builder, that is me building bridges between people, between races, between cultures, between politics, trying to find common ground.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: Resist your fear; fear will never lead to you a positive end. Go for your faith and what you believe.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: But I think my mistakes became the chemistry for my miracles. I think that my tests became my testimonies.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: I think the first step is to understand that forgiveness does not exonerate the perpetrator. Forgiveness liberates the victim. It's a gift you give yourself.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: I think it is important that we rebuild an atmosphere of forgiveness and civility in every aspect of our lives.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: So though there are many things I would have done differently, I submit to God's sovereignty and His purpose in my life and I thank Him that He brought me the way He brought me and gave me what He gave me when He thought I could handle it.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: There are no college courses to build up self-esteem or high school or elementary school. If you don't get those values at a early age, nurtured in your home, you don't get them.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: It is your passion that empowers you to be able to do that thing you were created to do.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: As a Christian, Christ died so that we will have eternal life in Him in Heaven. What it looks like doesn't matter, what it smells like doesn't matter, as long as Christ is there it will be Heaven to me.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: Here is the amazing thing about Easter; the Resurrection Sunday for Christians is this, that Christ in the dying moments on the cross gives us the greatest illustration of forgiveness possible.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: We develop our propensity to forgive or not to forgive by what we see illustrated at the early ages of our development.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: If you learn how to forgive others for not being strong, then people can learn how to forgive you for your own issues.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: I don't dislike anybody. I love everybody.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: I chose to present myself as one who comes from among the people, and I can be touched by their pain because I have my own.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: The first time I walked on a stage I knew that was what I was created to do. I knew that there was a calling and a sense of purpose in my life that gave me fulfillment and a sense of destiny.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: Children are not unforgiving. You can punish them and they will hug you in a few minutes.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: When you make a decision to forgive it's a decision that you have to make intellectually.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: I raised five children. They all have different personalities. All of them have different issues, different levels of success. That was a learning experience for me.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: Forgiveness is about empowering yourself, rather than empowering your past.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: One of the things about my ministry is that I have never branded myself as being above the people or superior to people.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: We cannot embrace God's forgiveness if we are so busy clinging to past wounds and nursing old grudges.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: I don't think that you can let the storms of life overwhelm you. When you do that, you are no better than the craziness that caused you to be under attack.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: I'm for people bettering themselves, no matter who they are and where they are, doing all they can to be all they can be.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: When my father died, I had a real experience with Christ, a real conversion with Christ and I had it in a Oneness church.
values.author: T. D. Jakes
values.authorOccupation: Pastor, author, filmmaker, talk show host

values.authorQuote: We shall not cease from exploration, and the end of all our exploring will be to arrive where we started and know the place for the first time.
values.author: T. S. Eliot

values.authorQuote: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
values.author: T. S. Eliot

values.authorQuote: So the darkness shall be the light, and the stillness the dancing.
values.author: T. S. Eliot

values.authorQuote: Home is where one starts from.
values.author: T. S. Eliot

values.authorQuote: I said to my soul, be still, and wait without hope, For hope would be hope for the wrong thing.
values.author: T. S. Eliot

values.authorQuote: Television is a medium of entertainment which permits millions of people to listen to the same joke at the same time, and yet remain lonesome.
values.author: T. S. Eliot

values.authorQuote: What we call the beginning is often the end. And to make an end is to make a beginning. The end is where we start from.
values.author: T. S. Eliot

values.authorQuote: If you aren't in over your head, how do you know how tall you are?
values.author: T. S. Eliot

values.authorQuote: For love would be love of the wrong thing; there is yet faith, But the faith and the love and the hope are all in the waiting.

values.authorQuote: The philosophy of fasting calls upon us to know ourselves, to master ourselves, and to discipline ourselves the better to free ourselves. To fast is to identify our dependencies, and free ourselves from them.

values.authorQuote: The first requisite of a good citizen in this republic of ours is that he shall be able and willing to pull his own weight.

values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: The boy who is going to make a great man must not make up his mind merely to overcome a thousand obstacles, but to win in spite of a thousand repulses and defeats.

values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, author, explorer, soldier, naturalist
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Every immigrant who comes here should be required within five years to learn English or leave the country.
values.author: Theodore Roosevelt
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, author, explorer, soldier, naturalist
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: The best executive is one who has sense enough to pick good people to do what he wants done, and self-restraint enough to keep from meddling with them while they do it.
values.author: Theodore Roosevelt
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, author, explorer, soldier, naturalist
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: I care not what others think of what I do, but I care very much about what I think of what I do! That is character!
values.author: Theodore Roosevelt
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, author, explorer, soldier, naturalist
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: It is only through labor and painful effort, by grim energy and resolute courage, that we move on to better things.
values.author: Theodore Roosevelt
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, author, explorer, soldier, naturalist
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
values.author: Theodore Roosevelt
values.authorOccupation: President of the United States, author, explorer, soldier, naturalist
values.authorBirthplace: New York City, New York, U.S.

values.authorQuote: In tough times, everyone has to take their share of the pain.

values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: I'd personally like to see the Human Rights Act go because I think we have had some problems with it.

values.authorQuote: I actually think I think better in high heels.
values.author: Theresa May
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: I've always championed women in politics. We just get stuck in; politics isn't a game. The decisions we make affect people's lives, and that is something we must all keep to the forefront of our minds.

values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: I will be ruthless in cutting out waste, streamlining structures and improving efficiency.

values.authorQuote: National security is the first duty of government but we are also committed to reversing the substantial erosion of civil liberties.

values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: I've been clear that Brexit means Brexit.
values.author: Theresa May
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: My whole philosophy is about doing, not talking.
values.author: Theresa May
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: A number of women have reportedly been victims of what appear to be discriminatory decisions taken by Sharia councils, and that is a significant concern.
values.author: Theresa May
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: I think it's important to do a good job and not to feel that you've got to make grand gestures, but just to get on and deliver.

values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: And it is crucial of course that chief constables are able to make decisions within their budgets about how they deploy their police officers to the greatest effect to ensure that they're able to do the job that the public want them to do.
values.author: Theresa May
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: Nobody wins when the police are sent to look after people suffering from mental health problems; vulnerable people don't get the care they need and deserve, and the police can't get on with the job they are trained to do.
values.author: Theresa May
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: Uncontrolled, mass immigration displaces British workers, forces people onto benefits, and suppresses wages for the low-paid.
values.author: Theresa May
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: We all know the stories about the Human Rights Act... about the illegal immigrant who cannot be deported because, and I am not making this up, he had a pet cat.
values.author: Theresa May
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: I'm not someone who feels anger on particular issues.
values.author: Theresa May
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: It's very important that we unite as a party and as a country.
values.author: Theresa May
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: There's much more we can be doing in Parliament, we could be giving more power back to people at local government level, through local referendums.
values.author: Theresa May
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: The aim is to create here in Britain a really hostile environment for illegal migration.
values.author: Theresa May
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: It does not make sense that everybody should duplicate efforts when we could be working together.
values.author: Theresa May
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: On gay adoption I have changed my mind.
values.author: Theresa May
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: It is very important that people see there is a bright future, and we can re-engage that entrepreneurial spirit of the trading nation for which the U.K. has always been known - that dynamic, creative spirit.
values.author: Theresa May
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: We know of officers who develop inappropriate relationships with victims of domestic abuse. They have ignored their professional duty and their moral responsibility.
values.author: Theresa May
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: It is quite widely known that I like shoes. This is not something that defines me as either a woman or a politician, but it has come to define me in the eyes of the newspapers. I wore a pair of leopard-print kitten heels to a Conservative Party Conference a few years ago and the papers have continued to focus on my feet ever since.
values.author: Theresa May
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: I don't tour the TV studios. I don't gossip over lunch. I don't drink in Parliament's bars. I don't wear my heart on my sleeve. I just get on with the job in front of me.
values.author: Theresa May
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: Many British people of different faiths follow religious codes and practices and benefit a great deal from the guidance they offer.
values.author: Theresa May
values.authorOccupation: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party

values.authorQuote: Because of your smile, you make life more beautiful.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: We humans have lost the wisdom of genuinely resting and relaxing. We worry too much. We don't allow our bodies to heal, and we don't allow our minds and hearts to heal.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: If you truly get in touch with a piece of carrot, you get in touch with the soil, the rain, the sunshine. You get in touch with Mother Earth and eating in such a way, you feel in touch with true life, your roots, and that is meditation. If we chew every morsel of our food in that way we become grateful and when you are grateful, you are happy.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: You carry Mother Earth within you. She is not outside of you. Mother Earth is not just your environment. In that insight of inter-being, it is possible to have real communication with the Earth, which is the highest form of prayer.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: If we are peaceful, if we are happy, we can smile, and everyone in our family, our entire society, will benefit from our peace.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: True self is non-self, the awareness that the self is made only of non-self elements. There's no separation between self and other, and everything is interconnected. Once you are aware of that you are no longer caught in the idea that you are a separate entity.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: Meditation can help us embrace our worries, our fear, our anger; and that is very healing. We let our own natural capacity of healing do the work.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: To meditate means to go home to yourself. Then you know how to take care of the things that are happening inside you, and you know how to take care of the things that happen around you.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: When we recognise the virtues, the talent, the beauty of Mother Earth, something is born in us, some kind of connection, love is born.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: People have a hard time letting go of their suffering. Out of a fear of the unknown, they prefer suffering that is familiar.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: Every breath we take, every step we make, can be filled with peace, joy and serenity.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: Let us fill our hearts with our own compassion - towards ourselves and towards all living beings.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: Changing is not just changing the things outside of us. First of all we need the right view that transcends all notions including of being and non-being, creator and creature, mind and spirit. That kind of insight is crucial for transformation and healing.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: We will be more successful in all our endeavors if we can let go of the habit of running all the time, and take little pauses to relax and re-center ourselves. And we'll also have a lot more joy in living.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: Many people are alive but don't touch the miracle of being alive.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: Anger is like a storm rising up from the bottom of your consciousness. When you feel it coming, turn your focus to your breath.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: In the past there were people who were not rich but contented with their living style, laughing and happy all day. values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: It's very important that we re-learn the art of resting and relaxing. Not only does it help prevent the onset of many illnesses that develop through chronic tension and worrying; it allows us to clear our minds, focus, and find creative solutions to problems.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: We need enlightenment, not just individually but collectively, to save the planet. We need to awaken ourselves. We need to practice mindfulness if we want to have a future, if we want to save ourselves and the planet.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: When you look at the sun during your walking meditation, the mindfulness of the body helps you to see that the sun is in you; without the sun there is no life at all and suddenly you get in touch with the sun in a different way.

values.authorQuote: Fearlessness is not only possible, it is the ultimate joy. When you touch nonfear, you are free.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: You practice mindfulness, on the one hand, to be calm and peaceful. On the other hand, as you practice mindfulness and live a life of peace, you inspire hope for a future of peace.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: Breathe in deeply to bring your mind home to your body. Then look at, or think of, the person triggering this emotion: With mindfulness, you can see that she is unhappy, that she is suffering. You can see her wrong perceptions. You can see that she is not beautiful when she says things that are unkind.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: You are a child of the sun, you come from the sun, and that is something true with the Earth also... your relationship with the Earth is so deep, and the Earth is in you and this is something not very difficult, much less difficult then philosophy.

values.authorQuote: Most of us experience a life full of wonderful moments and difficult moments. But for many of us, even when we are most joyful, there is fear behind our joy.

values.authorQuote: You know that your happiness and suffering depend on the happiness and suffering of others. That insight helps you not to do wrong things that will bring suffering to yourself and to other people.
values.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

values.authorQuote: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.

values.authorQuote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.

values.authorQuote: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.

values.authorQuote: There is no substitute for hard work.

values.authorQuote: Being busy does not always mean real work. The object of all work is production or accomplishment and to either of these ends there must be forethought, system, planning, intelligence, and honest purpose, as well as perspiration. Seeming to do is not doing.
values.author: Thomas A. Edison

values.authorQuote: There's a way to do it better - find it.
values.author: Thomas A. Edison

values.authorQuote: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.

values.authorQuote: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.

values.authorQuote: The three great essentials to achieve anything worth while are: Hard work, Stick-to-itiveness, and Common sense.

values.authorQuote: If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.

values.authorQuote: Just because something doesn't do what you planned it to do doesn't mean it's useless.

values.authorQuote: I never did a day's work in my life. It was all fun.
values.author: Thomas A. Edison

values.authorQuote: The chief function of the body is to carry the brain around.
values.author: Thomas A. Edison

values.authorQuote: Restlessness is discontent and discontent is the first necessity of progress. Show me a thoroughly satisfied man and I will show you a failure.

values.authorQuote: What you are will show in what you do.

values.authorQuote: To invent, you need a good imagination and a pile of junk.

values.authorQuote: I find my greatest pleasure, and so my reward, in the work that precedes what the world calls success.

values.authorQuote: To have a great idea, have a lot of them.
values.author: Thomas A. Edison

values.authorQuote: Your worth consists in what you are and not in what you have.
values.author: Thomas A. Edison

values.authorQuote: Non-violence leads to the highest ethics, which is the goal of all evolution. Until we stop harming all other living beings, we are still savages.
values.author: Thomas A. Edison

values.authorQuote: Discontent is the first necessity of progress.
values.author: Thomas A. Edison

values.authorQuote: One might think that the money value of an invention constitutes its reward to the man who loves his work. But... I continue to find my greatest pleasure, and so my reward, in the work that precedes what the world calls success.

values.authorQuote: Everything comes to him who hustles while he waits.

values.authorQuote: I start where the last man left off.

values.authorQuote: Religion is all bunk.

values.authorQuote: The value of an idea lies in the using of it.

values.authorQuote: There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship.

values.authorOccupation: Dominican friar, Catholic priest, Doctor of the Church

values.authorQuote: If, then, you are looking for the way by which you should go, take Christ, because He Himself is the way.

values.authorQuote: Human salvation demands the divine disclosure of truths surpassing reason.

values.author: Thomas Aquinas

values.author: Thomas Aquinas
values.authorOccupation: Dominican friar, Catholic priest, Doctor of the Church

values.authorQuote: Because philosophy arises from awe, a philosopher is bound in his way to be a lover of myths and poetic fables. Poets and philosophers are alike in being big with wonder.
values.author: Thomas Aquinas

values.authorQuote: Permanence, perseverance and persistence in spite of all obstacles, discouragements, and impossibilities: It is this, that in all things distinguishes the strong soul from the weak.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: He who has health, has hope; and he who has hope, has everything.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: Silence is as deep as eternity, speech a shallow as time.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: Love is not altogether a delirium, yet it has many points in common therewith.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: Nothing builds self-esteem and self-confidence like accomplishment.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: There are good and bad times, but our mood changes more often than our fortune.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: When the oak is felled the whole forest echoes with it fall, but a hundred acorns are sown in silence by an unnoticed breeze.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: Wondrous is the strength of cheerfulness, and its power of endurance - the cheerful man will do more in the same time, will do it; better, will preserve it longer, than the sad or sullen.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: No great man lives in vain. The history of the world is but the biography of great men.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: Isolation is the sum total of wretchedness to a man.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: A loving heart is the beginning of all knowledge.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: No pressure, no diamonds.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: Necessity dispenseth with decorum.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: Nothing stops the man who desires to achieve. Every obstacle is simply a course to develop his achievement muscle. It's a strengthening of his powers of accomplishment.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: What we become depends on what we read after all of the professors have finished with us. The greatest university of all is a collection of books.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: Our main business is not to see what lies dimly at a distance, but to do what lies clearly at hand.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: Not what I have, but what I do is my kingdom.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: A well-written life is almost as rare as a well-spent one.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: In every phenomenon the beginning remains always the most notable moment.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: Long stormy spring-time, wet contentious April, winter chilling the lap of very May; but at length the season of summer does come.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: It is a strange trade that of advocacy. Your intellect, your highest heavenly gift is hung up in the shop window like a loaded pistol for sale.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: Every noble work is at first impossible.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: If you are ever in doubt as to whether to kiss a pretty girl, always give her the benefit of the doubt.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: Go as far as you can see; when you get there you'll be able to see farther.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: A man lives by believing something: not by debating and arguing about many things.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: This world, after all our science and sciences, is still a miracle wonderful, inscrutable, magical and more, to whosoever will think of it.
values.author: Thomas Carlyle

values.authorQuote: It is not wisdom but Authority that makes a law.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: The condition of man... is a condition of war of everyone against everyone.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: Words are the money of fools.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: The right of nature... is the liberty each man hath to use his own power, as he will himself, for the preservation of his own nature; that is to say, of his own life.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: The obligation of subjects to the sovereign is understood to last as long, and no longer, than the power lasteth by which he is able to protect them.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: The disembodied spirit is immortal; there is nothing of it that can grow old or die. But the embodied spirit sees death on the horizon as soon as its day dawns.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: A wise man should so write (though in words understood by all men) that wise men only should be able to commend him.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: I put for the general inclination of all mankind, a perpetual and restless desire of power after power, that ceaseth only in death.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: Not believing in force is the same as not believing in gravitation.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: During the time men live without a common power to keep them all in awe, they are in that conditions called war; and such a war, as if of every man, against every man.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: That a man be willing, when others are so too, as far forth as for peace and defense of himself he shall think it necessary, to lay down this right to all things; and be contented with so much liberty against other men, as he would allow other men against himself.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: Prudence is but experience, which equal time, equally bestows on all men, in those things they equally apply themselves unto.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: Leisure is the Mother of Philosophy.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: No man's error becomes his own Law; nor obliges him to persist in it.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: All generous minds have a horror of what are commonly called 'Facts'. They are the brute beasts of the intellectual domain.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: In the state of nature profit is the measure of right.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: Such is the nature of men, that howsoever they may acknowledge many others to be more witty, or more eloquent, or more learned; yet they will hardly believe there be many so wise as themselves.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: Such truth, as opposeth no man's profit, nor pleasure, is to all men welcome.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: They that approve a private opinion, call it opinion; but they that dislike it, heresy; and yet heresy signifies no more than private opinion.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: There is no such thing as perpetual tranquillity of mind while we live here; because life itself is but motion, and can never be without desire, nor without fear, no more than without sense.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: He that is taken and put into prison or chains is not conquered, though overcome; for he is still an enemy.
values.author: Thomas Hobbes

values.authorQuote: The man who is aware of himself is henceforward independent; and he is never bored, and life is only too short, and he is steeped through and through with a profound yet temperate happiness.

values.authorQuote: It is true that liberty is precious; so precious that it must be carefully rationed.

values.authorQuote: Everything will probably never be OK. But we have to try for it.

values.authorQuote: At least in Russia, you cannot just go and tap into someone's phone conversation without a warrant issued by court. That's more or less the way a civilized society should go about fighting terrorism.

values.authorQuote: The Negro race, like all races, is going to be saved by its exceptional men. values.authorQuote: Before and after emancipation, the Negro, in self-defense, was propelled toward the white employer. values.authorQuote: All art is propaganda, and ever must be, despite the wailing of the purists. values.authorQuote: I believe in the Prince of Peace. I believe that War is Murder. values.authorQuote: From the day of its birth, the anomaly of slavery plagued a nation which asserted the equality of all men, and sought to derive powers of government from the consent of the governed. values.author: W. Edwards Deming

values.authorQuote: I am forever learning and changing.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: If you do not know how to ask the right question, you discover nothing.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: The big problems are where people don't realise they have one in the first place.
values.author: W. Edwards Deming
values.authorOccupation: Engineer, statistician, professor, author, lecturer, management consultant

values.authorQuote: If you can dream it, you can do it.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: We keep moving forward, opening new doors, and doing new things, because we're curious and curiosity keeps leading us down new paths.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: All the adversity I've had in my life, all my troubles and obstacles, have strengthened me... You may not realize it when it happens, but a kick in the teeth may be the best thing in the world for you.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: You can design and create, and build the most wonderful place in the world. But it takes people to make the dream a reality.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: Times and conditions change so rapidly that we must keep our aim constantly focused on the future.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: It's kind of fun to do the impossible.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: When you're curious, you find lots of interesting things to do.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: Movies can and do have tremendous influence in shaping young lives in the realm of entertainment towards the ideals and objectives of normal adulthood.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: There is more treasure in books than in all the pirate's loot on Treasure Island.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: Mickey Mouse popped out of my mind onto a drawing pad 20 years ago on a train ride from Manhattan to Hollywood at a time when business fortunes of my brother Roy and myself were at lowest ebb and disaster seemed right around the corner.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: Of all of our inventions for mass communication, pictures still speak the most universally understood language.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: When you believe in a thing, believe in it all the way, implicitly and unquestionable.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: I only hope that we don't lose sight of one thing - that it was all started by a mouse.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: You're dead if you aim only for kids. Adults are only kids grown up, anyway.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: Animation offers a medium of story telling and visual entertainment which can bring pleasure and information to people of all ages everywhere in the world.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: I do not like to repeat successes, I like to go on to other things.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: I always like to look on the optimistic side of life, but I am realistic enough to know that life is a complex matter.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: I would rather entertain and hope that people learned something than educate people and hope they were entertained.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: Our heritage and ideals, our code and standards - the things we live by and teach our children - are preserved or diminished by how freely we exchange ideas and feelings.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: Mickey Mouse is, to me, a symbol of independence. He was a means to an end.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: We believed in our idea - a family park where parents and children could have fun- together.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: You reach a point where you don't work for money.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: Of all the things I've done, the most vital is coordinating those who work with me and aiming their efforts at a certain goal.
values.author: Walt Disney
values.authorOccupation: Entrepreneur, animator, voice actor, film producer

values.authorQuote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.
values.author: Walt Whitman

values.authorQuote: I am as bad as the worst, but, thank God, I am as good as the best.
values.author: Walt Whitman

values.authorQuote: Simplicity is the glory of expression.
values.author: Walt Whitman

values.authorQuote: I have learned that to be with those I like is enough.
values.author: Walt Whitman

values.authorQuote: I believe a leaf of grass is no less than the journey-work of the stars.
values.author: Walt Whitman

values.authorQuote: To me, every hour of the day and night is an unspeakably perfect miracle.
values.author: Walt Whitman

values.authorQuote: Give me odorous at sunrise a garden of beautiful flowers where I can walk undisturbed.
values.author: Walt Whitman

values.authorQuote: The art of art, the glory of expression and the sunshine of the light of letters, is simplicity.
values.author: Walt Whitman
